unnormalised: What are some practical waste management tips that can be easily adopted in Indian households?
normalised: What are some practical waste management tips that can be easily adopted in Indian households?

unnormalised: Okay folks, let's talk Kachra! Waste management is something close to my heart, and honestly, crucial for Bharat's future. We can’t keep turning Delhi into a landfill, right?
normalised: Okay folks, let us talk Kachra! Waste management is something close to my heart, and honestly, crucial for Bharat's future. We can not keep turning Delhi into a landfill, right?

unnormalised: First, segregation is key. Separate your biodegradable waste (vegetable peels, leftover roti, etc.) from recyclables (paper, plastic, glass). My dadi always had two separate bins. If Dadi can do it, so can we!
normalised: First, segregation is key. Separate your biodegradable waste (vegetable peels, leftover roti, etcetera) from recyclables (paper, plastic, glass). My dadi always had two separate bins. If Dadi can do it, so can we!

unnormalised: For biodegradable waste, consider composting! Even a small terrace garden in Mumbai can benefit from homemade compost. You can even use a simple tumbler composter. No fancy equipment needed.
normalised: For biodegradable waste, consider composting! Even a small terrace garden in Mumbai can benefit from homemade compost. You can even use a simple tumbler composter. No fancy equipment needed.

unnormalised: Regarding recyclables, check with your local kabadiwala (scrap dealer). They often pay for paper, plastic bottles, and metal. Think of it as earning a little pocket money while helping the environment!
normalised: Regarding recyclables, check with your local kabadiwala (scrap dealer). They often pay for paper, plastic bottles, and metal. Think of it as earning a little pocket money while helping the environment!

unnormalised: Reduce, reuse, recycle – remember the mantra. Avoid single-use plastics whenever possible. Carry your own jute bag to the market like my friend Priya does in Chennai.
normalised: Reduce, reuse, recycle – remember the mantra. Avoid single-use plastics whenever possible. Carry your own jute bag to the market like my friend Priya does in Chennai.

unnormalised: Also, a lot of e-waste gets dumped carelessly. Institutions like IIT Madras are doing amazing work in developing eco-friendly e-waste management techniques. Look into partnering with authorized e-waste collectors.
normalised: Also, a lot of e-waste gets dumped carelessly. Institutions like I I T Madras are doing amazing work in developing eco-friendly e-waste management techniques. Look into partnering with authorized e-waste collectors.

unnormalised: Finally, spread awareness! Even a small conversation with your neighbors about reducing waste can make a difference. Remember that dialogue from "Lagaan"? "Thoda Thoda Karke, Hum Sab Jeet Jaayenge" (Little by little, we will all win!). Let’s win this fight against kachra together. What are your tips? Share them in the comments!
